metadata.title: CVE-2013-1895 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The py-bcrypt module before 0.3 for Python does not properly handleconcurrent memory access, which allows attackers to bypass authenticationvia multiple authentication requests, which trigger the password hash to beoverwritten.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-1895` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-bcrypt - 0.4-1
python3-bcrypt - 0.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python-bcrypt package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.4-1').
